bibl.title: "Isis is a Greek Word". Plutarch's Allegorization of Egyptian Religion.
bibl.note: I. Introduction. - II. Dawson's theories of allegorical interpretation. - III. Plutarch's major Platonic allegory. - IV. Plutarch's secondary Platonic allegory. - V. Conclusion. Did Dawson's theory go awry?

bibl.title: Plutarco, Platón y Aristóteles. Actas del V Congreso Internacional de la I.P.S. (Madrid - Cuenca, 4-7 de Mayo de 1999)

bibl.seg: BRENK Frederick E., "Isis is a Greek Word". Plutarch's Allegorization of Egyptian Religion.

Aurelio PÉREZ JIMÉNEZ, José GARCÍA LÓPEZ y Rosa Ma. AGUILAR (Eds.), Plutarco, Platón y Aristóteles. Actas del V Congreso Internacional de la I.P.S. (Madrid - Cuenca, 4-7 de Mayo de 1999) (Madrid, 1999) pp. 227-238.

I. Introduction. - II. Dawson's theories of allegorical interpretation. - III. Plutarch's major Platonic allegory. - IV. Plutarch's secondary Platonic allegory. - V. Conclusion. Did Dawson's theory go awry?
